list.title: ICAL
list.description: The main ICAL module. Provides access to everything else.

list.title: ICAL.Binary
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Binary instance

list.title: ICAL.Binary#decodeValue
list.description: Base64 decode the current value

list.title: ICAL.Binary#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.Binary#setEncodedValue
list.description: Encodes the passed parameter with base64 and sets the internal value to the result.

list.title: ICAL.Binary#toString
list.description: The string representation of this value

list.title: ICAL.Binary.fromString
list.description: Creates a binary value from the given string.

list.title: ICAL.Component
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Component instance.

list.title: ICAL.Component#addProperty
list.description: Adds an {@link ICAL.Property} to the component.

list.title: ICAL.Component#addPropertyWithValue
list.description: Helper method to add a property with a value to the component.

list.title: ICAL.Component#addSubcomponent
list.description: Adds a single sub component.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getAllProperties
list.description: Get all properties in the component, optionally filtered by name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getAllSubcomponents
list.description: Finds all sub components, optionally filtering by name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getFirstProperty
list.description: Finds the first property, optionally with the given name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getFirstPropertyValue
list.description: Returns first property's value, if available.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getFirstSubcomponent
list.description: Finds first sub component, optionally filtered by name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#getTimeZoneByID
list.description: Retrieve a time zone definition from the component tree, if any is present. If the tree contains no time zone definitions or the TZID cannot be matched, returns null.

list.title: ICAL.Component#hasProperty
list.description: Returns true when a named property exists.

list.title: ICAL.Component#name
list.description: The name of this component

list.title: ICAL.Component#removeAllProperties
list.description: Removes all properties associated with this component, optionally filtered by name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#removeAllSubcomponents
list.description: Removes all components or (if given) all components by a particular name.

list.title: ICAL.Component#removeProperty
list.description: Removes a single property by name or the instance of the specific property.

list.title: ICAL.Component#removeSubcomponent
list.description: Removes a single component by name or the instance of a specific component.

list.title: ICAL.Component#toJSON
list.description: Returns the Object representation of this component. The returned object is a live jCal object and should be cloned if modified.

list.title: ICAL.Component#toString
list.description: The string representation of this component.

list.title: ICAL.Component#updatePropertyWithValue
list.description: Helper method that will update or create a property of the given name and sets its value. If multiple properties with the given name exist, only the first is updated.

list.title: ICAL.Component.fromString
list.description: Create an {@link ICAL.Component} by parsing the passed iCalendar string.

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.ComponentParser instance.

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#oncomplete
list.description: Fired when parsing is complete

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#onerror
list.description: Fired if an error occurs during parsing.

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#onevent
list.description: Fired when a top level component (VEVENT) is found.

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#ontimezone
list.description: Fired when a top level component (VTIMEZONE) is found

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#parseEvent
list.description: When true, parse events

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#parseTimezone
list.description: When true, parse timezones

list.title: ICAL.ComponentParser#process
list.description:
Process a string or parse ical object. This function itself will return nothing but will start the parsing process.

Events must be registered prior to calling this method.

list.title: ICAL.Duration
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Duration instance.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the duration object.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#compare
list.description: Compares the duration instance with another one.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#days
list.description: The days in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration#fromData
list.description: Sets up the current instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#fromSeconds
list.description: Reads the passed seconds value into this duration object. Afterwards, members like {@link ICAL.Duration#days days} and {@link ICAL.Duration#weeks weeks} will be set up accordingly.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#hours
list.description: The days in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#isNegative
list.description: The seconds in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration#minutes
list.description: The minutes in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration#normalize
list.description: Normalizes the duration instance. For example, a duration with a value of 61 seconds will be normalized to 1 minute and 1 second.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#reset
list.description: Resets the duration instance to the default values, i.e. PT0S

list.title: ICAL.Duration#seconds
list.description: The seconds in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration#toICALString
list.description: The iCalendar string representation of this duration.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#toSeconds
list.description: The duration value expressed as a number of seconds.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#toString
list.description: The string representation of this duration.

list.title: ICAL.Duration#weeks
list.description: The weeks in this duration

list.title: ICAL.Duration.fromData
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Duration instance from the given data object.

list.title: ICAL.Duration.fromSeconds
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.Duration instance from the passed seconds value.

list.title: ICAL.Duration.fromString
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.Duration} instance from the passed string.

list.title: ICAL.Duration.isValueString
list.description: Checks if the given string is an iCalendar duration value.

list.title: ICAL.Event
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Event instance.

list.title: ICAL.Event#attendees
list.description: The attendees in the event

list.title: ICAL.Event#color
list.description: The event color from rfc7986

list.title: ICAL.Event#description
list.description: The event description.

list.title: ICAL.Event#duration
list.description: The duration. This can be the result directly from the property, or the duration calculated from start date and end date. Setting the property will remove any dtend properties.

list.title: ICAL.Event#endDate
list.description: The end date. This can be the result directly from the property, or the end date calculated from start date and duration. Setting the property will remove any duration properties.

list.title: ICAL.Event#exceptions
list.description: List of related event exceptions.

list.title: ICAL.Event#findRangeException
list.description: Finds the range exception nearest to the given date.

list.title: ICAL.Event#getOccurrenceDetails
list.description:
Returns the occurrence details based on its start time. If the occurrence has an exception will return the details for that exception.

NOTE: this method is intend to be used in conjunction with the {@link ICAL.Event#iterator iterator} method.

list.title: ICAL.Event#getRecurrenceTypes
list.description:
Returns the types of recurrences this event may have.

Returned as an object with the following possible keys:

  • YEARLY
  • MONTHLY
  • WEEKLY
  • DAILY
  • MINUTELY
  • SECONDLY

list.title: ICAL.Event#isRecurrenceException
list.description: Checks if the event describes a recurrence exception. See {@tutorial terminology} for details.

list.title: ICAL.Event#isRecurring
list.description: Checks if the event is recurring

list.title: ICAL.Event#iterator
list.description: Builds a recur expansion instance for a specific point in time (defaults to startDate).

list.title: ICAL.Event#location
list.description: The location of the event.

list.title: ICAL.Event#modifiesFuture
list.description: Checks if this record is an exception and has the RANGE=THISANDFUTURE value.

list.title: ICAL.Event#organizer
list.description: The organizer value as an uri. In most cases this is a mailto: uri, but it can also be something else, like urn:uuid:...

list.title: ICAL.Event#recurrenceId
list.description: The recurrence id for this event. See {@tutorial terminology} for details.

list.title: ICAL.Event#relateException
list.description:
Relates a given event exception to this object. If the given component does not share the UID of this event it cannot be related and will throw an exception.

If this component is an exception it cannot have other exceptions related to it.

list.title: ICAL.Event#sequence
list.description: The sequence value for this event. Used for scheduling see {@tutorial terminology}.

list.title: ICAL.Event#startDate
list.description: The start date

list.title: ICAL.Event#strictExceptions
list.description: When true, will verify exceptions are related by their UUID.

list.title: ICAL.Event#summary
list.description: The event summary

list.title: ICAL.Event#toString
list.description: The string representation of this event.

list.title: ICAL.Event#uid
list.description: The uid of this event

list.title: ICAL.Event.occurrenceDetails
list.description: This object is returned by {@link ICAL.Event#getOccurrenceDetails getOccurrenceDetails}

list.title: ICAL.Period
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Period instance. The passed data object cannot contain both and end date and a duration.

list.title: ICAL.Period#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the duration object.

list.title: ICAL.Period#duration
list.description: The duration of the period

list.title: ICAL.Period#end
list.description: The end of the period

list.title: ICAL.Period#getDuration
list.description: Calculates the duration of the period, either directly or by subtracting start from end date.

list.title: ICAL.Period#getEnd
list.description: Calculates the end date of the period, either directly or by adding duration to start date.

list.title: ICAL.Period#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.Period#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.Period#start
list.description: The start of the period

list.title: ICAL.Period#toICALString
list.description: The iCalendar string representation of this period.

list.title: ICAL.Period#toJSON
list.description: The jCal representation of this period type.

list.title: ICAL.Period#toString
list.description: The string representation of this period.

list.title: ICAL.Period.fromData
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.Period} instance from the given data object. The passed data object cannot contain both and end date and a duration.

list.title: ICAL.Period.fromJSON
list.description: Returns a new period instance from the given jCal data array. The first member is always the start date string, the second member is either a duration or end date string.

list.title: ICAL.Period.fromString
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.Period} instance from the passed string.

list.title: ICAL.Property
list.description:
Creates a new ICAL.Property instance.

It is important to note that mutations done in the wrapper directly mutate the jCal object used to initialize.

Can also be used to create new properties by passing the name of the property (as a String).

list.title: ICAL.Property#getDefaultType
list.description: Get the default type based on this property's name.

list.title: ICAL.Property#getFirstParameter
list.description: Gets first parameter on the property.

list.title: ICAL.Property#getFirstValue
list.description: Finds the first property value.

list.title: ICAL.Property#getParameter
list.description: Gets a parameter on the property.

list.title: ICAL.Property#getValues
list.description:
Gets all values on the property.

NOTE: this creates an array during each call.

list.title: ICAL.Property#name
list.description: The name of this property, in lowercase.

list.title: ICAL.Property#parent
list.description: The parent component for this property.

list.title: ICAL.Property#removeAllValues
list.description: Removes all values from this property

list.title: ICAL.Property#removeParameter
list.description: Removes a parameter

list.title: ICAL.Property#resetType
list.description: Sets type of property and clears out any existing values of the current type.

list.title: ICAL.Property#setParameter
list.description: Sets a parameter on the property.

list.title: ICAL.Property#setValue
list.description: Sets the current value of the property. If this is a multi-value property, all other values will be removed.

list.title: ICAL.Property#setValues
list.description: Sets the values of the property. Will overwrite the existing values. This can only be used for multi-value properties.

list.title: ICAL.Property#toICALString
list.description: The string representation of this component.

list.title: ICAL.Property#toJSON
list.description: Returns the Object representation of this component. The returned object is a live jCal object and should be cloned if modified.

list.title: ICAL.Property#type
list.description: The value type for this property

list.title: ICAL.Property.fromString
list.description: Create an {@link ICAL.Property} by parsing the passed iCalendar string.

list.title: ICAL.Recur
list.description: Create a new instance of the Recur class.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#addComponent
list.description: Adds a component (part) to the recurrence rule. This is not a component in the sense of {@link ICAL.Component}, but a part of the recurrence rule, i.e. BYMONTH.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the recurrence object.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#count
list.description: The maximum number of occurrences

list.title: ICAL.Recur#freq
list.description: The frequency value.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#fromData
list.description: Sets up the current instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#getComponent
list.description: Gets (a copy) of the requested component value.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#getNextOccurrence
list.description:
Retrieves the next occurrence after the given recurrence id. See the guide on {@tutorial terminology} for more details.

NOTE: Currently, this method iterates all occurrences from the start date. It should not be called in a loop for performance reasons. If you would like to get more than one occurrence, you can iterate the occurrences manually, see the example on the {@link ICAL.Recur#iterator iterator} method.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#interval
list.description: The interval value for the recurrence rule.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#isByCount
list.description: Checks if the current rule has a count part, and not limited by an until part.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#isFinite
list.description: Checks if the current rule is finite, i.e. has a count or until part.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#iterator
list.description: Create a new iterator for this recurrence rule. The passed start date must be the start date of the event, not the start of the range to search in.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#parts
list.description: An object holding the BY-parts of the recurrence rule

list.title: ICAL.Recur#setComponent
list.description: Sets the component value for the given by-part.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#toJSON
list.description: The jCal representation of this recurrence type.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#toString
list.description: The string representation of this recurrence rule.

list.title: ICAL.Recur#until
list.description: The end of the recurrence

list.title: ICAL.Recur#wkst
list.description: The week start day

list.title: ICAL.Recur.frequencyValues
list.description: Possible frequency values for the FREQ part (YEARLY, MONTHLY, WEEKLY, DAILY, HOURLY, MINUTELY, SECONDLY)

list.title: ICAL.Recur.fromData
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.Recur} instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Recur.fromString
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.Recur} instance from the passed string.

list.title: ICAL.Recur.icalDayToNumericDay
list.description: Convert an ical representation of a day (SU, MO, etc..) into a numeric value of that day.

list.title: ICAL.Recur.numericDayToIcalDay
list.description: Convert a numeric day value into its ical representation (SU, MO, etc..)

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion
list.description:
Creates a new ICAL.RecurExpansion instance.

The options object can be filled with the specified initial values. It can also contain additional members, as a result of serializing a previous expansion state, as shown in the example.

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#complete
list.description: True when iteration is fully completed.

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#dtstart
list.description: Start date of recurring rules.

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#fromData
list.description: Initialize the recurrence expansion from the data object. The options object may also contain additional members, see the {@link ICAL.RecurExpansion constructor} for more details.

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#last
list.description: Last expanded time

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#next
list.description: Retrieve the next occurrence in the series.

list.title: ICAL.RecurExpansion#toJSON
list.description: Converts object into a serialize-able format. This format can be passed back into the expansion to resume iteration.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.RecurIterator instance. The options object may contain additional members when resuming iteration from a previous run.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#completed
list.description: True when iteration is finished.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#dtstart
list.description: The start date of the event being iterated.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#fromData
list.description: Initialize the recurrence iterator from the passed data object. This method is usually not called directly, you can initialize the iterator through the constructor.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#last
list.description: The last occurrence that was returned from the {@link ICAL.RecurIterator#next} method.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#last.year
list.description: The normalization horrors below are due to the fact that when the year/month/day changes it can effect the other operations that come after.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#next
list.description: Retrieve the next occurrence from the iterator.

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#occurrence_number
list.description: The sequence number from the occurrence

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#rule
list.description: The rule that is being iterated

list.title: ICAL.RecurIterator#toJSON
list.description: Convert iterator into a serialize-able object. Will preserve current iteration sequence to ensure the seamless continuation of the recurrence rule.

list.title: ICAL.Time
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Time instance.

list.title: ICAL.Time#DEFAULT_WEEK_START
list.description: The default weekday for the WKST part.

list.title: ICAL.Time#addDuration
list.description: Adds the duration to the current time. The instance is modified in place.

list.title: ICAL.Time#adjust
list.description: Adjust the date/time by the given offset

list.title: ICAL.Time#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the time object.

list.title: ICAL.Time#compare
list.description: Compares the ICAL.Time instance with another one.

list.title: ICAL.Time#compareDateOnlyTz
list.description: Compares only the date part of this instance with another one.

list.title: ICAL.Time#convertToZone
list.description: Convert the instance into another timezone. The returned ICAL.Time instance is always a copy.

list.title: ICAL.Time#dayOfWeek
list.description: Calculate the day of week.

list.title: ICAL.Time#dayOfYear
list.description: Calculate the day of year.

list.title: ICAL.Time#daysInYearPassedMonth
list.description: The days that have passed in the year after a given month. The array has two members, one being an array of passed days for non-leap years, the other analog for leap years.

list.title: ICAL.Time#endOfMonth
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, shifted to the end of the month. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#endOfWeek
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, shifted to the end of the week. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#endOfYear
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, shifted to the end of the year. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#epochTime
list.description: January 1st, 1970 as an ICAL.Time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#fromData
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Time instance from the the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Time#fromData
list.description: Sets up the current instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Time#fromJSDate
list.description: Set up the current instance from the Javascript date value.

list.title: ICAL.Time#fromUnixTime
list.description: Sets up the current instance from unix time, the number of seconds since January 1st, 1970.

list.title: ICAL.Time#getDominicalLetter
list.description: Get the dominical letter for the current year. Letters range from A - G for common years, and AG to GF for leap years.

list.title: ICAL.Time#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.Time#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object. This value may change and is strictly defined by the {@link ICAL.Time#isDate isDate} member.

list.title: ICAL.Time#isNthWeekDay
list.description: Checks if current time is the nth weekday, relative to the current month. Will always return false when rule resolves outside of current month.

list.title: ICAL.Time#nthWeekDay
list.description: Finds the nthWeekDay relative to the current month (not day). The returned value is a day relative the month that this month belongs to so 1 would indicate the first of the month and 40 would indicate a day in the following month.

list.title: ICAL.Time#reset
list.description: Reset the time instance to epoch time

list.title: ICAL.Time#resetTo
list.description: Reset the time instance to the given date/time values.

list.title: ICAL.Time#startDoyWeek
list.description: First calculates the start of the week, then returns the day of year for this date. If the day falls into the previous year, the day is zero or negative.

list.title: ICAL.Time#startOfMonth
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, rewound to the start of the month. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#startOfWeek
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, rewound to the start of the week. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#startOfYear
list.description: Returns a copy of the current date/time, rewound to the start of the year. The resulting ICAL.Time instance is of icaltype date, even if this is a date-time.

list.title: ICAL.Time#subtractDate
list.description: Subtract the date details (excluding timezone). Useful for finding the relative difference between two time objects excluding their timezone differences.

list.title: ICAL.Time#subtractDateTz
list.description: Subtract the date details, taking timezones into account.

list.title: ICAL.Time#toICALString
list.description: Returns an RFC 5545 compliant ical representation of this object.

list.title: ICAL.Time#toJSDate
list.description: Converts the current instance to a Javascript date

list.title: ICAL.Time#toJSON
list.description: Converts time to into Object which can be serialized then re-created using the constructor.

list.title: ICAL.Time#toString
list.description: The string representation of this date/time, in jCal form (including : and - separators).

list.title: ICAL.Time#toUnixTime
list.description: Converts the current instance to seconds since January 1st 1970.

list.title: ICAL.Time#utcOffset
list.description: Calculates the UTC offset of the current date/time in the timezone it is in.

list.title: ICAL.Time#weekNumber
list.description:
Calculates the ISO 8601 week number. The first week of a year is the week that contains the first Thursday. The year can have 53 weeks, if January 1st is a Friday.

Note there are regions where the first week of the year is the one that starts on January 1st, which may offset the week number. Also, if a different week start is specified, this will also affect the week number.

list.title: ICAL.Time#zone
list.description: The timezone for this time.

list.title: ICAL.Time.daysInMonth
list.description: Returns the days in the given month

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromDateString
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.Time instance from a date string, e.g 2015-01-02.

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromDateTimeString
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.Time instance from a date-time string, e.g 2015-01-02T03:04:05. If a property is specified, the timezone is set up from the property's TZID parameter.

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromDayOfYear
list.description: Create a new ICAL.Time from the day of year and year. The date is returned in floating timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromJSDate
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Time instance from the given Javascript Date.

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromString
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.Time instance from a date or date-time string,

list.title: ICAL.Time.fromStringv2
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.Time instance from a date string, e.g 2015-01-02.

list.title: ICAL.Time.getDominicalLetter
list.description: Get the dominical letter for the given year. Letters range from A - G for common years, and AG to GF for leap years.

list.title: ICAL.Time.isLeapYear
list.description: Checks if the year is a leap year

list.title: ICAL.Time.now
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Time instance from the current moment. The instance is “floating” - has no timezone relation. To create an instance considering the time zone, call ICAL.Time.fromJSDate(new Date(), true)

list.title: ICAL.Time.weekDay
list.description: The weekday, 1 = SUNDAY, 7 = SATURDAY. Access via ICAL.Time.MONDAY, ICAL.Time.TUESDAY, ...

list.title: ICAL.Time.weekOneStarts
list.description: Returns the date on which ISO week number 1 starts.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Timezone instance, by passing in a tzid and component.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#component
list.description: The vtimezone component for this timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#fromData
list.description: Sets up the current instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#latitude
list.description: The primary latitude for the timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#location
list.description: Timezone location

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#longitude
list.description: The primary longitude for the timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#toString
list.description: The string representation of this timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#tzid
list.description: Timezone identifier

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#tznames
list.description: Alternative timezone name, for the string representation

list.title: ICAL.Timezone#utcOffset
list.description: Finds the utcOffset the given time would occur in this timezone.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone.convert_time
list.description: Convert the date/time from one zone to the next.

list.title: ICAL.Timezone.fromData
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.Timezone instance from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.UtcOffset instance.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the utc offset object.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#compare
list.description: Compare this utc offset with another one.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#factor
list.description: The sign of the utc offset, 1 for positive offset, -1 for negative offsets.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#fromData
list.description: Sets up the current instance using members from the passed data object.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#fromSeconds
list.description: Sets up the current instance from the given seconds value. The seconds value is truncated to the minute. Offsets are wrapped when the world ends, the hour after UTC+14:00 is UTC-12:00.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#hours
list.description: The hours in the utc-offset

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#minutes
list.description: The minutes in the utc-offset

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#toICALString
list.description: The iCalendar string representation of this utc-offset.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#toSeconds
list.description: Convert the current offset to a value in seconds

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset#toString
list.description: The string representation of this utc-offset.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset.fromSeconds
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.UtcOffset} instance from the passed seconds value.

list.title: ICAL.UtcOffset.fromString
list.description: Creates a new {@link ICAL.UtcOffset} instance from the passed string.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime
list.description: Creates a new ICAL.VCardTime instance.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime#clone
list.description: Returns a clone of the vcard date/time object.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime#icalclass
list.description: The class identifier.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime#icaltype
list.description: The type name, to be used in the jCal object.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime#toICALString
list.description: Returns an RFC 6350 compliant representation of this object.

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime#toString
list.description: The string representation of this date/time, in jCard form (including : and - separators).

list.title: ICAL.VCardTime.fromDateAndOrTimeString
list.description: Returns a new ICAL.VCardTime instance from a date and/or time string.

list.title: ICAL.design.designSet
list.description: A designSet describes value, parameter and property data. It is used by ther parser and stringifier in components and properties to determine they should be represented.

list.title: ICAL.module:TimezoneService.get
list.description: Returns a timezone by its tzid if present.

list.title: ICAL.module:TimezoneService.has
list.description: Checks if timezone id has been registered.

list.title: ICAL.module:TimezoneService.register
list.description: Registers a timezone object or component.

list.title: ICAL.module:TimezoneService.remove
list.description: Removes a timezone by its tzid from the list.

list.title: ICAL.module:design
list.description: The design data, used by the parser to determine types for properties and other metadata needed to produce correct jCard/jCal data.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.components
list.description: Holds the design set for known top-level components

list.title: ICAL.module:design.defaultSet
list.description: The default set for new properties and components if none is specified.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.defaultType
list.description: The default type for unknown properties

list.title: ICAL.module:design.getDesignSet
list.description: Gets the design set for the given component name.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.icalendar
list.description: The design set for iCalendar (rfc5545/rfc7265) components.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.strict
list.description: Can be set to false to make the parser more lenient.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.vcard
list.description: The design set for vCard (rfc6350/rfc7095) components.

list.title: ICAL.module:design.vcard3
list.description: The design set for vCard (rfc2425/rfc2426/rfc7095) components.

list.title: ICAL.module:design~date.undecorate
list.description: undecorates a time object.

list.title: ICAL.module:design~icalSet
list.description: iCalendar design set

list.title: ICAL.module:design~vcard3Set
list.description: vCard 3.0 design set

list.title: ICAL.module:design~vcardSet
list.description: vCard 4.0 design set

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers
list.description: Helper functions used in various places within ical.js

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.binsearchInsert
list.description: Find the index for insertion using binary search.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.clone
list.description: Clone the passed object or primitive. By default a shallow clone will be executed.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.extend
list.description: Poor-man's cross-browser object extension. Doesn't support all the features, but enough for our usage. Note that the target's properties are not overwritten with the source properties.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.foldline
list.description: Performs iCalendar line folding. A line ending character is inserted and the next line begins with a whitespace.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.formatClassType
list.description: Creates or returns a class instance of a given type with the initialization data if the data is not already an instance of the given type.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.isStrictlyNaN
list.description: Checks if the given type is of the number type and also NaN.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.pad2
list.description: Pads the given string or number with zeros so it will have at least two characters.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.strictParseInt
list.description: Parses a string value that is expected to be an integer, when the valid is not an integer throws a decoration error.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.trunc
list.description: Truncates the given number, correctly handling negative numbers.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.unescapedIndexOf
list.description: Identical to indexOf but will only match values when they are not preceded by a backslash character.

list.title: ICAL.module:helpers.updateTimezones
list.description: Compiles a list of all referenced TZIDs in all subcomponents and removes any extra VTIMEZONE subcomponents. In addition, if any TZIDs are referenced by a component, but a VTIMEZONE does not exist, an attempt will be made to generate a VTIMEZONE using ICAL.TimezoneService.

list.title: ICAL.parse(function)
list.description: Parses iCalendar or vCard data into a raw jCal object. Consult documentation on the {@tutorial layers|layers of parsing} for more details.

list.title: ICAL.parse._rfc6868Escape
list.description: Internal helper for rfc6868. Exposing this on ICAL.parse so that hackers can disable the rfc6868 parsing if the really need to.

list.title: ICAL.parse.component
list.description: Convenience method to parse a component. You can use ICAL.parse() directly instead.

list.title: ICAL.parse.property
list.description: Parse an iCalendar property value into the jCal for a single property

list.title: ICAL.stringify(function)
list.description: Convert a full jCal/jCard array into a iCalendar/vCard string.

list.title: ICAL.stringify.component
list.description:
Converts an jCal component array into a ICAL string. Recursive will resolve sub-components.

Exact component/property order is not saved all properties will come before subcomponents.

list.title: ICAL.stringify.multiValue
list.description: Converts an array of ical values into a single string based on a type and a delimiter value (like ",").

list.title: ICAL.stringify.property
list.description: Converts a single jCal/jCard property to a iCalendar/vCard string.

list.title: ICAL.stringify.propertyValue
list.description:
Handles escaping of property values that may contain:

COLON (:), SEMICOLON (;), or COMMA (,)

If any of the above are present the result is wrapped in double quotes.

list.title: ICAL.stringify.value
list.description: Processes a single ical value runs the associated "toICAL" method from the design value type if available to convert the value.

list.title: module.exports.foldLength
list.description: The number of characters before iCalendar line folding should occur

list.title: module.exports.newLineChar
list.description: The character(s) to be used for a newline. The default value is provided by rfc5545.

list.title: parse._handleContentLine~result
list.description:
Note on var result juggling:

I observed that building the array in pieces has adverse effects on performance, so where possible we inline the creation. It is a little ugly but resulted in ~2000 additional ops/sec.

list.title: stringify._rfc6868Unescape
list.description: Internal helper for rfc6868. Exposing this on ICAL.stringify so that hackers can disable the rfc6868 parsing if the really need to.
